body:
Instead of building and serving devtools independently, we want to make a request to flutter daemon to start serving devtools which should already be built.

This change requires https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/62702 to be merged internally.

comment_data.body: comment why we do this for Bazel only for now (non-bazel projects currently have a flutter daemon with an older version of devtools).
should we report an error here? We weren't able to open devtools as the app closed.
at each async boundary we probably need to make sure the project hasn't been closed in whcih case we should quietly cancel the request.
use your username for new TODOs
one more thing. we also don't do any flutter version checking so this wouldn't be safe externally as stable probably doesn't support this daemon api.

nit: create a little Value class for this instead of using Pair.
With Pair it isn't obvious what the two fields are but it would be really obvious with a simple data class with a `host` and `port` field.
This means a check of whether someone has closed down the IntelliJ project? And we probably should also check if the app has been disconnected?
I didn't want to put my name here since I just moved this block of code without changes, do you think this is enough of a change where I should take ownership of the TODO?
you did the right thing. I saw the lower one was a move but I didn't scroll up high enough to spot this one.

commit.message: Use daemon API to start devtools internally WIP
Use isPresent check instead of isEmpty
Handle if devtools host and port are null
Add comment explaining why only bazel projects uses daemon
Use value class for address and add comments
Remove check for app connection since DevTools can handle

repo.description: Flutter makes it easy and fast to build beautiful mobile apps.
repo.name: flutter-intellij

title: Use daemon API to get devtools host and port for internal use
